title: 1963 DFB-Pokal Final
text:
The 1963 DFB-Pokal Final decided the winner of the <a href="1962%E2%80%9363%20DFB-Pokal">1962–63 DFB-Pokal</a>, the 20th season of Germany's knockout <a href="Association%20football">football</a> cup competition. It was played on 14 August 1963 at the <a href="Niedersachsenstadion">Niedersachsenstadion</a> in <a href="Hanover">Hanover</a>. <a href="Hamburger%20SV">Hamburger SV</a> won the match 3–0 against <a href="Borussia%20Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a>, to claim their 1st cup title.
Route to the final.
The DFB-Pokal began with 16 teams in a <a href="single-elimination%20tournament">single-elimination</a> knockout cup competition. There were a total of three rounds leading up to the final. Teams were drawn against each other, and the winner after 90 minutes would advance. If still tied, 30 minutes of <a href="Overtime%20%28sports%29%23Association%20football">extra time</a> was played. If the score was still level, a <a href="Replay%20%28sports%29%23Association%20football">replay</a> would take place at the original away team's stadium. If still level after 90 minutes, 30 minutes of extra time was played. If the score was still level, a <a href="Sortition">drawing of lots</a> would decide who would advance to the next round.
"Note: In all results below, the score of the finalist is given first (H: home; A: away)."
Match.
